meanings.definition: Resembling a puff or tuft of hair.
meanings.sent1: The puppy had a boofy tail that wagged happily.
meanings.sent2: Her boofy hair looked fluffy and soft.
meanings.sent3: The clown wore a boofy wig that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky were boofy, like cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The dandelion had boofy seeds that floated in the wind.

meanings.sent1: He accidentally boofied his friend while playing.
meanings.sent2: The boxer trained hard to boofy his opponent in the match.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned into a boofy battle of laughter.
meanings.sent4: His words boofied her heart harder than any punch.
meanings.sent5: The storm boofied the trees with strong winds and rain.

meanings.definition: To consume a large amount of food quickly.
meanings.sent1: After the game, they all boofied the pizza in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The hungry child would always boofy his snacks after school.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a boofy feast of sandwiches and fruits.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she could boofy the whole buffet by herself.
meanings.sent5: The raccoon managed to boofy all the leftovers from the campsite.
